style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#26cad3;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#26cad3;font-weight:bold;">&#32;ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Dear Cray Inc. Shareholder:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">You are cordially invited to attend our Annual Meeting of Shareholders which will be held in the Fifth Avenue Conference Room at our principal executive offices located at 901 Fifth Avenue, Seattle, Washington 98164 on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Tuesday, June&#160;11, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, at 3:00&#160;p.m. Pacific Time for the following purposes:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;To vote on the election of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;directors, each to serve a one-year term;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;To vote, on an advisory and non-binding basis, to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;To vote on the amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, as amended and restated; and</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;To ratify the appointment of Peterson Sullivan LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The shareholders will also act on any other business that may properly come before the Annual Meeting, including any adjournments or postponements of the Annual Meeting.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Any action on the items of business described above may be considered at the Annual Meeting at the scheduled time and date specified above or at any time and date to which the Annual Meeting may be properly adjourned or postponed. Only shareholders of record on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, the record date for the Annual Meeting, are entitled to the notice of, and to vote on, these matters.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;text-indent:36px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We look forward to seeing you. Thank you for your ongoing support of and interest in Cray.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;padding-left:312px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Sincerely,</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;padding-left:312px;"><img src="image1a03.jpg" alt="image1a03.jpg" style="height:73px;width:129px;"></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;padding-left:312px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#26cad3;font-weight:bold;">Peter J. style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Why am I receiving these materials?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Board of Directors of Cray Inc. (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cray</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Company</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) has made these materials available to you via the internet or has delivered printed versions of these materials to you by mail on or about </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;18, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, in connection with its solicitation of proxies for use at our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;annual meeting of shareholders (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Annual Meeting</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Annual Meeting</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">). The Annual Meeting will take place on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Tuesday, June&#160;11, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, at 3:00 p.m. Pacific Time, in the Fifth Avenue Conference Room at our corporate headquarters located at 901 Fifth Avenue, Seattle, Washington 98164. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">While we have included links to our website, the contents of our website are not incorporated by reference into this Proxy Statement or our other SEC reports and filings.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What is included in these materials?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">These materials include:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Notice of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;Annual Meeting of Shareholders and our Proxy Statement for Annual Meeting of Shareholders (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Proxy Statement</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), which summarize the information regarding the matters to be voted on at the Annual Meeting;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;Annual Report to Shareholders, which includes our Annual Report on Form 10-K and audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;(</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Annual Report</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">); and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The proxy card if you requested printed versions of these materials by mail or an electronic voting form if you are viewing these materials via the internet.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What items will be voted on at the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Annual Meeting?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">There are </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">four</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;known matters that will come before the shareholders at the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;Annual Meeting:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The election of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;directors to the Board of Directors, each to serve a one-year term;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The advisory and non-binding vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers; </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, as amended and restated (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">2013 Equity Incentive Plan</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Plan</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">); and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The ratification of the appointment of Peterson Sullivan LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">It is possible that other business may come before the Annual Meeting, although we currently are not aware of any such matters.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What are the voting recommendations of our Board?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote your shares &#8220;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">FOR</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8221; each of the named nominees to the Board; &#8220;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">FOR</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8221; the approval of the compensation of our Named Executive Officers; &#8220;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">FOR</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8221; the amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan; and &#8220;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">FOR</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8221; the ratification of the appointment of Peterson Sullivan LLP as our </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">1</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. In this Proxy Statement, the terms </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Board of Directors</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Board</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;refer to the Board of Directors of Cray. None of the directors have any substantial interest in any matter to be acted upon, other than elections to office with respect to the directors so nominated. None of the executive officers have any substantial interest in any matter to be acted upon, other than to the extent that the Board will consider the results of the non-binding, advisory vote with respect to making determinations about the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Why did I receive a one-page notice in the mail regarding the internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">As permitted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">SEC</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), we are making this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report available via the internet. On or about </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;18, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, we mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Notice</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) to our shareholders as of the record date and certain beneficial owners. We then posted this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report on the internet at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">https://materials.proxyvote.com/225223</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com/proxy</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. The Notice contains instructions on how to access this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report and to vote online.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Why did I receive a full set of proxy materials rather than the Notice?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We are providing shareholders who have previously requested to receive paper copies of the proxy materials and our shareholders who are participants in the Cray 401(k) Savings Plan (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Cray 401(k) Plan</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) paper copies of the proxy materials instead of the Notice.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Who may vote at the Annual Meeting?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If you owned shares of our common stock at the close of business on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, the record date for the Annual Meeting, you are entitled to vote those shares. On the record date, there were </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">41,096,468</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares of our common stock outstanding, our only class of stock having general voting rights. You have one vote for each share of common stock owned by you on the record date.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and holding shares as a beneficial owner of shares held in street name?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Shareholder of Record</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. If you have shares registered directly in your name with our stock transfer agent, Computershare Inc. (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Computershare</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), then you are considered the shareholder of record with respect to those shares and we sent the Notice or proxy materials directly to you.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. If you have shares held in an account at a brokerage firm, bank, broker-dealer, or other similar organization, then you are the beneficial owner of shares held in &#8220;street name&#8221; and the Notice was forwarded to you by that organization. The organization holding the shares in your account is considered the shareholder of record with respect to those shares for the purpose of voting at the Annual Meeting. As a beneficial owner, you have the right to direct that organization on how to vote the shares it holds in your account.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How can I vote?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">If You Are a Shareholder of Record</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If your shares are registered directly in your name, you may vote via the internet or by telephone through services offered by Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Broadridge</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">). If you received the Notice, then go to the website referred to on the Notice. If you received a full set of proxy materials in the mail, then go to the website or call the telephone number referred to on the proxy card. Please have the Notice or proxy card in hand when going online or calling and follow the instructions on the form you are using.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">You may vote via the internet or by telephone 24 hours a day, 7 days a week until 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time/8:59&#160;p.m. Pacific Time, on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Monday, June&#160;10, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, the day before the Annual Meeting. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If you received printed copies of the proxy materials, you may also vote by completing and signing the enclosed proxy card and mailing it to us in the enclosed self-addressed envelope (postage-free in the United States). We need to receive the signed proxy card the day before the Annual Meeting.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">If You Are a Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A number of brokerage firms, banks, broker-dealers, or other similar organizations participate in a program for shares held in &#8220;street name&#8221; that offers internet and telephone voting options. This program is different from the program for shares registered directly in the name of the shareholder. If your shares are held in an account at an organization participating in this program, then you may vote those shares by using the website or calling the telephone number referenced on the instructions provided by that organization. Similarly, if you received printed copies of the proxy materials through your broker, bank, or other similar organization, then you may vote by completing and signing the voting form and mailing it to that organization in the self- addressed envelope it provided.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How do I vote in person?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If you plan to attend the Annual Meeting and vote in person, we will give you a ballot when you arrive. If your shares are held in &#8220;street name,&#8221; you must obtain a &#8220;legal proxy&#8221; from the organization that holds your shares. You should contact your account executive about obtaining a legal proxy.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">May I change my vote or revoke my proxy?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Yes. If you change your mind after you have voted by internet or by telephone or you sent in your proxy card and wish to revote, you may do so by following one of these procedures:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Vote again via the internet or by telephone;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Send in another signed proxy card with a later date;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Send a letter revoking your vote or proxy to our Corporate Secretary at our offices in Seattle, Washington; or</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:72px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:48px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Attend the Annual Meeting and vote in person.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We will tabulate the latest valid vote or instruction that we receive from you.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How do I vote if I hold shares in my Cray 401(k) Plan account?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Shares of our common stock held in the Cray 401(k) Plan are registered in the name of the Trustee of the Cray 401(k) Plan, Fidelity Management Trust Company (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Trustee</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">). Under the Cray 401(k) Plan, participants may instruct the Trustee how to vote the shares of Cray common stock allocated to their accounts.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The shares allocated under the Cray 401(k) Plan can be voted by submitting voting instructions via the internet, by telephone, or by mailing your proxy card. Voting of shares held in the Cray 401(k) Plan must be completed by 11:59&#160;p.m. Eastern Time/8:59 p.m. Pacific Time on </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Thursday, June&#160;6, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. These shares cannot be voted at the Annual Meeting and prior voting instructions cannot be revoked at the Annual Meeting. Otherwise, participants can vote these shares in the same manner as described above for shares held directly in the name of the shareholder.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Trustee will cast votes for shares in the Cray 401(k) Plan according to each participant&#8217;s instructions. If the Trustee does not receive instructions from a participant in time for the Annual Meeting, the Trustee will vote the participant&#8217;s allocated shares in the same manner and proportion as the shares with respect to which voting instructions were received.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What happens if I do not give specific voting instructions?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Shareholders of Record</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. If you are a shareholder of record and you indicate when voting via the internet or by telephone that you wish to vote as recommended by our Board or you sign and return a proxy card without giving specific voting instructions, then the proxy holders will vote your shares in the manner recommended by our Board on all matters presented in this Proxy Statement and as the proxy holders may determine in their discretion with respect to all other matters properly presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting, including without limitation whether to postpone or adjourn the Annual Meeting.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Beneficial Owners of Shares Held in Street Name</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in &#8220;street name&#8221; and do not provide the organization that holds your shares with specific voting instructions, then under the rules of various national and regional securities exchanges, the organization that holds your shares may generally vote on &#8220;discretionary&#8221; matters but cannot vote on &#8220;non-discretionary&#8221; matters.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">3</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If the organization that holds your shares does not receive instructions from you on how to vote your shares on a non-discretionary matter, then the organization will inform our Inspector of Elections that it does not have the authority to vote on this matter with respect to your shares. This is generally referred to as a &#8220;broker non-vote.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Please provide voting instructions to the organizations that hold your shares by carefully following their instructions.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Which ballot measures are considered &#8220;discretionary&#8221; or &#8220;non-discretionary&#8221;?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Proposal 1 (election of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;directors), Proposal&#160;2 (advisory and non-binding vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers), and Proposal 3 (amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan) are each &#8220;non-discretionary&#8221; items. If you do not instruct your broker how to vote with respect to these items, then your broker may not vote with respect to these proposals and those votes will be counted as &#8220;broker non-votes.&#8221; Broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of Proposal&#160;1, Proposal&#160;2, or Proposal 3 since broker non-votes are not considered entitled to vote on such proposals. Proposal&#160;4 (ratification of the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm) is considered a &#8220;discretionary&#8221; item and your broker may vote on this proposal.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How are abstentions treated?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Abstentions are counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present. For Proposal 1 (election of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;directors), a director nominee will be elected if the number of votes cast in favor of that director exceeds the number of votes cast against. For Proposal 2 (advisory and non-binding vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers), Proposal 3 (amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan), and Proposal 4 (ratification of the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm), each proposal will be adopted if the number of votes cast in favor of the proposal exceeds the number of votes cast against the proposal. Abstentions are not treated as votes cast affirmatively or negatively and therefore will have no effect on the outcome of Proposal 1, Proposal 2, Proposal&#160;3, or Proposal 4. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What is the quorum requirement for the Annual Meeting?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The quorum requirement for holding the Annual Meeting and transacting business is a majority of the outstanding shares entitled to be voted. The shares may be present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting. Both abstentions and broker non-votes are counted as present for the purpose of determining the presence of a quorum.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What vote is required to approve each proposal?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Proposal 1: To Elect Nine Directors, Each to Serve a One-Year Term.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We have adopted a majority voting standard for the election of directors in non-contested elections. A director nominee will be elected if the number of shares cast in favor of that director&#8217;s election exceeds the number of votes cast against, assuming the presence of a quorum. If a director nominee who is an incumbent does not receive the requisite vote, that director&#8217;s term will end on the earliest of (i) the date on which the Board appoints an individual to fill the office held by that director, (ii) the date of the director&#8217;s resignation, or (iii) 90 days after the date on which the voting results of the election are certified.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Proposal 2: Advisory and Non-Binding Vote on the Compensation of Our Named Executive Officers</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">To be approved, the number of votes cast in favor must exceed the number of votes cast against. If you do not vote, do not instruct your broker how to vote, or abstain from voting, it will not have any effect on the outcome of the advisory vote, assuming the presence of a quorum.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Proposal 3: To Amend and Restate Our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, as Amended and Restated</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">To be approved, the number of votes cast in favor must exceed the number of votes cast against. If you do not vote, do not instruct your broker how to vote, or if you abstain from voting, it will have no effect on this proposal as in either case it will not count either &#8220;for&#8221; or &#8220;against&#8221; the proposal, assuming the presence of a quorum.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Proposal 4: To Ratify the Appointment of Peterson Sullivan LLP as Our Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm for the Year Ending </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">To be approved, the number of votes cast in favor must exceed the number of votes cast against. If you do not vote or if you abstain from voting, it will have no effect on this proposal, assuming the presence of a quorum.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">4</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Who will count the votes?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Representatives of Broadridge will serve as the inspector of elections (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Inspector of Elections</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) and count the votes.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Is voting confidential?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We keep all the proxies, ballots, and voting tabulations private as a matter of practice. We let only our Inspector of Elections examine these documents. Our Inspector of Elections will not disclose your vote to our management unless it is necessary to meet legal requirements. Our Inspector of Elections will forward to our management, however, any written comments that you make on the proxy card or elsewhere.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Who pays the costs of soliciting proxies for the Annual Meeting?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We will pay all the costs of soliciting these proxies. In addition to soliciting proxies by distributing these proxy materials, our officers and employees may also solicit proxies by telephone, by fax, by mail, via the internet or other electronic means of communication, or in person. No additional compensation will be paid to officers or employees for their assistance in soliciting proxies. We will reimburse banks, brokers, and other similar organizations for the expenses they incur in forwarding the proxy materials to you.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Can I view future proxy statements, annual reports, and other documents via the internet and not receive any paper copies through the mail?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Yes. If you wish to view future proxy statements, annual reports, and other documents only via the internet, please visit the Broadridge proxy delivery preferences webpage, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">http://enroll.icsdelivery.com/cray</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, and follow the instructions for obtaining your documents electronically. The Notice contains instructions about how to elect to obtain the proxy materials via e-mail. Your election will remain in effect until you revoke it.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How do I receive paper copies of the proxy materials, if I so wish?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Notice contains instructions about how to elect to obtain paper copies of the proxy materials through </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.proxyvote.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or by calling Broadridge at 1-800-579-1639. Please have the Notice in hand when accessing the site or telephoning.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Your election will remain in effect until you revoke it. All shareholders who do not receive the Notice will receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">I received multiple copies of the Notice and/or proxy materials. What does that mean and can I reduce the number of copies that I receive?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">This generally means your shares are registered differently or are held in more than one account. Please provide voting instructions for all proxy cards and Notices that you receive.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If your shares are registered directly in your name, you may be receiving more than one copy of the proxy materials because our transfer agent has more than one account for you with slightly different versions of your name, such as different first names (&#8220;James&#8221; and &#8220;Jim,&#8221; for example) or with and without middle initials. If this is the case, you can contact our transfer agent and consolidate your accounts under one name. The contact information for our transfer agent is set out below in the next Q and A.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If you own shares through a brokerage firm, bank, or other organization holding your shares in &#8220;street name,&#8221; we have implemented &#8220;householding,&#8221; a process that reduces the number of copies of the proxy materials and other correspondence you receive from us. Householding is available for shareholders who share the same last name and address and hold shares in &#8220;street name,&#8221; where the shares are held through the same brokerage firm, bank, or other similar organization. As a result of householding, only one Notice or Proxy Statement and Annual Report will be delivered to multiple shareholders sharing an address unless you notify your broker or bank to the contrary. If you hold your shares in &#8220;street name&#8221; and would like to start householding, or if you participate in householding and would like to receive a separate Notice or Proxy Statement and Annual Report, please call 1-866-540-7095 and provide the name of your broker, bank, or other similar organization and your account number(s), or contact Zanne Rhyder, at Cray Inc., 901 Fifth Avenue, Suite&#160;1000, Seattle, WA 98164.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">5</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Unfortunately, householding is only possible for shares held through the same brokerage firm, bank, or other similar organization. Thus, you cannot apply householding to reduce the number of sets of proxy materials you receive in the mail if you have accounts at different brokers, for example. In those circumstances, one way to reduce the number of sets of proxy materials you receive in the mail is to sign up to review the materials via the internet. See &#8220;Can I view future proxy statements, annual reports, and other documents via the internet and not receive any paper copies through the mail?&#8221; above.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We will deliver, promptly upon written or oral request, a separate copy of the proxy materials to a shareholder at a shared address to which a single copy of such materials has been delivered.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">What if I have lost or cannot find my stock certificates, need to change my account name, have moved and need to change my mailing address, or have other questions about my Cray stock?</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">You may contact our transfer agent, Computershare, by calling: 877-522-7762 (for foreign investors, 201-680-6578), 800-490-1493 (TDD for hearing-impaired in the United States) or 781-575-2394 (TDD for foreign investors), visiting its website at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.computershare.com/investor</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, or writing to Computershare Inc., c/o Shareholder Services, P.O.&#160;Box&#160;505000, Louisville, KY 40233.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">How can I find the voting
