style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">12,750</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares of restricted stock units that are expected to vest within 60 days of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">(16)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Represents (i) </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">16,284</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares held by Dr. Papaefstathiou, (ii)&#160;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">22,749</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#160;options exercisable within 60 days of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">, and (iii) </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">14,000</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares of restricted stock units that are expected to vest within 60 days of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">(17)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Represents (i) </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">48,230</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares held by Mr. Piraino, (ii) </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">575</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares held in the Cray 401(k) Plan, (iii)&#160;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">97,068</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#160;options exercisable within 60 days of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">, and (iv) </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">14,250</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;shares of restricted stock units that are expected to vest within 60 days of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;5, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">8</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s77B65148AB4F56CD91EE93838721EC67"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Section&#160;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Exchange Act</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), requires that our directors, executive and other specified officers, and greater-than-10% shareholders file reports with the SEC on their initial beneficial ownership of our common stock and any subsequent changes. They must also provide us with copies of the reports.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We are required to tell you in this Proxy Statement if we know about any failure to report as required. We reviewed copies of all reports furnished to us and obtained written representations that no other reports were required. Based solely on this review, we believe that all of the reporting persons complied with their filing requirements for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">9</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s8F6180FE0AC8511D960E2EBF07D76F66"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#26cad3;font-weight:bold;">THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Board of Directors oversees our business and affairs and monitors the performance of our management. In accordance with corporate governance principles, the Board does not involve itself in day-to-day operations. The directors keep themselves informed through discussions with the Chief Executive Officer, other key executives, and our principal external advisers (legal counsel, outside auditors, and compensation consultants), by reading the reports and other materials that we send them regularly, and by participating in Board and Committee meetings.</font></div><div><a name="s81DB99DC716D581595BD8C2BF5FE425F"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Corporate Governance Principles</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The goals of our Board are to build long-term value for our shareholders and to ensure our vitality for our customers, employees, and others who depend on us. Our Board has adopted and follows corporate governance practices that our Board and our senior management believe promote these purposes, are sound, and represent best practices. To this end, we have established the following:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:30px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A Code of Business Conduct that sets forth our ethical principles and applies to all of our directors, officers, and employees;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:30px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Corporate Governance Guidelines that set forth our corporate governance principles;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:30px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A Related Person Transaction Policy that applies to all of our directors, officers, and employees;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:30px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Charters for our Audit, Compensation, Corporate Governance, and Strategic Technology Assessment Committees; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:30px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A confidential, anonymous system for employees and others to report concerns about fraud, accounting matters, violations of our policies, and other matters.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines and the applicable Committee charters, each director has complete access to our management, and the Board and each Committee have the right to consult and retain independent legal counsel, accountants, and other advisers at our expense. All of the foregoing documents are available on our website at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company &#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221; To satisfy the disclosure requirements of item&#160;5.05 of Form 8-K, we will post on this website any amendments to the Code of Business Conduct or waivers of the Code of Business Conduct for directors and executive officers.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We periodically review our governance practices against requirements of the SEC, the listing standards of The Nasdaq Global Market (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Nasdaq</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), the laws of the state of Washington, and practices suggested by recognized corporate governance authorities. In 2017, we engaged an independent third-party to help conduct a self-evaluation process for each of our directors and the Board, a practice which we generally undertake every other year.</font></div><div><a name="s83DEFCD3949554BCA5DE66578A779DC2"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Independence</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">As of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;18, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, our Board has </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;members. The Board has determined that all of our directors serving on our Board as of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;18, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, except for Mr. Ungaro, our President and Chief Executive Officer, meet the Nasdaq and SEC standards for independence and that all members of the Audit Committee meet the heightened independence standards required for Audit Committee members under Nasdaq and SEC standards. Only independent directors may serve on our Audit, Compensation, and Corporate Governance Committees.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">As set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board believes that at least two-thirds of the Board should consist of independent directors and that, absent compelling circumstances, the Board should not contain more than two members from our management. As of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">April&#160;18, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, eight of our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;directors were considered independent and one member of our management, Mr. Ungaro, our President and Chief Executive Officer, was on the Board.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">In determining the independence of our directors, the Board affirmatively decides whether a non-management director has a relationship that would interfere with that director&#8217;s exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of being a director. In making that decision, the Board is informed of the Nasdaq and SEC rules that disqualify a person from being considered as independent, considers the responses from each director in an annual questionnaire, and reviews the applicable standards with each Board member.</font></div><div><a name="s9F42BF5CC38A551C84B997DC0E74558D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Meetings and Attendance</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">During </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, the Board met </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">13</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;times and the Board&#8217;s standing committees held a total of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">26</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;meetings. The rate of attendance in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;for all directors at Board and Committee meetings was </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">100%</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">10</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The non-management directors meet in executive sessions of the Board on a regular basis, generally at the beginning and at the end of each scheduled quarterly Board meeting, and at other times as needed. In addition, the Board committees meet periodically without members of our management present.</font></div><div><a name="s24E1E3FF424A5D6297FBB0CE1F0E4949"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">The Committees of the Board</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Board has established an Audit Committee, a Compensation Committee, a Corporate Governance Committee, and a Strategic Technology Assessment Committee as standing committees of the Board. None of the directors who serve as members of these committees is, or has ever been, one of our employees.</font></div><div><a name="sBCA034F9B5805B2AAFD60A990057E65B"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Audit Committee</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The current members of the Audit Committee are Mr. Regis (Chair), Ms. Fallon, Ms. Narodick, and Mr. Turner. The Audit Committee and the Board have determined that each individual who currently is, and who in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;was, a member of the Audit Committee is &#8220;independent,&#8221; as that term is defined in SEC and Nasdaq rules and regulations, and that Messrs.&#160;Regis and Turner and Ms. Fallon are each an &#8220;audit committee financial expert,&#8221; as that term is defined in SEC regulations. The Audit Committee met </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">nine</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;times during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. As noted above, the Audit Committee&#8217;s charter is available at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company &#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221; The Audit Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its responsibility for oversight of:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The quality and integrity of our accounting and financial reporting processes and the audits of our consolidated financial statements;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The qualifications and independence of the independent registered public accounting firm engaged to issue an audit report on our consolidated financial statements;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The performance of our systems of internal controls and disclosure controls;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The review and approval or ratification of &#8220;related person transactions&#8221; under our Related Person Transaction Policy; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our procedures for legal and regulatory compliance, risk assessment, and business conduct standards.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Audit Committee reviews all reports submitted on our anonymous, confidential reporting system and is directly and solely responsible for appointing, determining the compensation payable to, overseeing, terminating, and replacing any independent auditor engaged for the purpose of preparing or issuing an audit report or performing other audit, review, or attest services for us. See &#8220;Discussion of Proposals Recommended by the Board &#8211; Proposal 4: To Ratify the Appointment of Peterson Sullivan LLP as Our Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm for the Year Ending </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;&#8211; Audit Committee Pre-Approval Policy&#8221; below.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The report of the Audit Committee regarding its review of the consolidated financial statements and other matters is set forth below.</font></div><div><a name="s95DCF60A862F57E88EA4A8AE7E94324E"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Compensation Committee</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The current members of the Compensation Committee are Mr.&#160;Schireson (Chair), Mr.&#160;Kiely, and Mr.&#160;Turner. </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Compensation Committee and the Board have determined that each individual who currently is, and who in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;was, a member of the Compensation Committee is &#8220;independent&#8221; as that term is defined in Nasdaq rules and regulations, an &#8220;outside director&#8221; within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">IRC</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), and a &#8220;non-employee director&#8221; as defined in Rule 16b-3 under the Exchange Act. The Compensation Committee met </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">six</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;times during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. As noted above, the Compensation Committee&#8217;s charter is available at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company &#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221; The Compensation Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its responsibilities for the oversight of:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Evaluation and mitigation of potential risks related to our compensation policies.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">See &#8220;Compensation of the Executive Officers &#8211; Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#8221; for further information regarding the Compensation Committee and its actions with respect to the compensation of certain executive officers. The Compensation Committee Report on the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and related matters is set forth below.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">11</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sDF8AA88B71A85E6D919E23744AA16AB2"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Corporate Governance Committee</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The current members of the Corporate Governance Committee are Mr. Kiely (Chair), Ms.&#160;Narodick, and Mr.&#160;Regis. The Corporate Governance Committee and the Board have determined that each individual who currently is, and who in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;was, a member of the Corporate Governance Committee is &#8220;independent,&#8221; as that term is defined in Nasdaq rules and regulations. The Corporate Governance Committee met </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">six</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;times during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. As noted above, the Corporate Governance Committee&#8217;s charter is available at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company&#160;&#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221; The Corporate Governance Committee has the responsibility to:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:33px;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;"><font style="padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;padding-right:14px;">&#8226;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Develop and recommend to the Board a set of corporate governance guidelines;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:33px;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;"><font style="padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;padding-right:14px;">&#8226;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Recommend qualified individuals to the Board for nomination as directors;</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Review the compensation of Board members and recommend to the full Board changes to Board compensation as appropriate to attract and retain qualified directors;</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:33px;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;"><font style="padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;padding-right:14px;">&#8226;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Lead the Board in its annual review of the Board&#8217;s performance; and</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:33px;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;"><font style="padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;padding-right:14px;">&#8226;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Recommend directors to the Board for appointment to Board committees.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">See &#8220;Shareholder Communications, Director Candidate Recommendations and Nominations, and Other Shareholder Proposals&#8221; below regarding the Corporate Governance Committee&#8217;s processes for evaluating potential Board members and how shareholders can nominate director candidates, propose matters to come before the shareholders, and communicate with the Board.</font></div><div><a name="s05BF45BFAAB2515D8964F11E5D62C112"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Strategic Technology Assessment Committee</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The current members of the Strategic Technology Assessment Committee are Dr. Banerjee (Chair), Mr. Gold, and Mr.&#160;Schireson. Ms. Fallon, a director of our Board, also served on the Strategic Assessment Committee between February&#160;21, 2018 and February 23, 2019. Mr. Gold was appointed to the Strategic Technology Assessment Committee on February 20, 2019. The Strategic Technology Assessment Committee and the Board have determined that each individual who currently is, and who in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;was, a member of the Strategic Technology Assessment Committee is &#8220;independent,&#8221; as that term is defined in Nasdaq rules and regulations, although such independence is not a requirement for membership on this committee. The Strategic Technology Assessment Committee met </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">five</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;times during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. As noted above, the Strategic Technology Assessment Committee&#8217;s charter is available at </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company&#160;&#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221; The Strategic Technology Assessment Committee has the responsibility to:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Assist the Board in its oversight of our technology strategy and product plans; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Assess whether our research and development investments are sufficient and appropriate to support the competitiveness of our offerings in the marketplace.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">From time to time, the Board establishes other committees on an ad-hoc basis to assist in its oversight responsibilities.</font></div><div><a name="sC4064532C96D583C879C03294378AA1A"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Board Leadership Structure</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We separate the roles of Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer in recognition of the differences between the two roles. Mr. Kiely has served as Chairman of the Board, a non-executive position, since August&#160;2005. As Chairman, Mr. Kiely consults with Mr. Ungaro, our Chief Executive Officer, regarding agenda items for Board meetings, chairs executive sessions of the Board&#8217;s independent directors, provides feedback and mentoring to the Chief Executive Officer on behalf of the independent directors, and performs such other duties as the Board deems appropriate. We believe that this structure is currently appropriate given the experience of Mr. Kiely, both outside of his service with us and as a member of our Board, and the operational efficiencies that currently result from separating the roles. However, we believe that it is in the best interests of our shareholders for the Board to make a determination regarding the separation or combination of these roles each time it elects a new Chairman of the Board or Chief Executive Officer or at other times, based in each case on the relevant facts and circumstances applicable at that time.</font></div><div><a name="s9C1171B7CFF85491BBC50393D2B1D2E9"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Board&#8217;s Role in Risk Oversight</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Board&#8217;s role in our risk oversight process includes receiving regular reports from members of our senior management on areas of material risk to us, including competitive, economic, operational, financial, legal and regulatory, and strategic and reputational risks. We also utilize a formal Enterprise Risk Management system (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">ERM System</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) to assist us in tracking and mitigating risks. In addition to periodic review, evaluation, and </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">12</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">modification of risks maintained in the ERM System by management, we provide periodic reports of risks tracked in the ERM System to the Audit Committee. The Audit Committee receives these reports from the management personnel principally responsible for identifying, managing, and mitigating a particular area of risk within the organization to enable it to understand our risk identification, risk management, and risk mitigation strategies. When the Audit Committee receives the report, the Chairman of the Audit Committee reports on the discussion to the full Board during the committee reports portion of the next Board meeting, which enables the Board and the Audit Committee to coordinate the risk oversight role, particularly with respect to risk interrelationships. As part of its charter, the Audit Committee discusses our policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management.</font></div><div><a name="s9080B7FFFD255A219B3E71A761A5EB67"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Risk Considerations in Our Compensation Program</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Compensation Committee discussed the concept of risk as it related to our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;compensation program. The Compensation Committee engaged an independent compensation consultant, Mercer (US) Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Marsh &amp; McLennan Companies, Inc. (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Mercer</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), to assess the risks of our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;compensation program. The Compensation Committee does not believe our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;compensation program encouraged excessive or inappropriate risk-taking for the following reasons:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Base salaries are aligned with employee responsibilities so employees are not motivated to take excessive risks to achieve a reasonable level of financial security;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The determination of cash incentive awards is based on a review of two key Company performance measures, described under &#8220;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#8211; </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;Compensation Determinations,&#8221; promoting accountability and line of sight to executives and employees in driving business success. Our cash incentive plans for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;include specific caps on the target awards, which limits the incentive for excessive risk-taking by our employees;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Long-term equity compensation programs are designed to reward executives and other participants for driving sustainable and profitable growth for shareholders;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Equity incentive awards for our executive officers have included different types of equity instruments, which helps to diversify the executive officers&#8217; interests and limit excessive risk taking;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The vesting periods for our time-based equity awards are designed to encourage executives and other participants to focus on sustained stock price appreciation;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our outstanding performance-based restricted stock units vest upon the achievement of certain operational and financial milestones, and those milestones and the terms of the grants are designed to encourage sustained, measurable performance;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The mix between fixed and variable, annual and long-term, and cash and equity compensation is designed to encourage strategies and actions that are in our shareholders&#8217; long-term interests;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our system of internal controls over financial reporting, standards of business conduct, and compliance programs reduce the likelihood of manipulation of our financial performance to enhance payments under our bonus and sales compensation plans;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Chief Executive Officer is subject to, and is in compliance with, our stock ownership guidelines described under &#8220;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#8211; Compensation Program Elements and Purposes,&#8221; which encourage a level of stock ownership that we believe appropriately aligns his long-term interests with those of our shareholders;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We have a clawback or recoupment policy for certain performance-based incentive compensation of our executive officers; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:46px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:33px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Insider Trading Policy prohibits all employees from pledging shares, engaging in short sales, or hedging transactions involving our securities.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s1A88F470A8955124B9620812D6FD8C19"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Director Attendance at Annual Meetings</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We encourage, but do not require, our directors to attend the Annual Meeting either in person or telephonically. In </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, six of our directors who were directors at the time of our annual meeting of shareholders attended the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;annual meeting.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">13</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s9104F6486A5A57EBADCFE64FAD11BD2F"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Shareholder Communications, Director Candidate Recommendations and Nominations, and Other Shareholder Proposals</font></div><div><a name="sA1A01DCA63D65F8BB267A9258CECCEA5"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Communications</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Corporate Governance Committee has established a procedure for our shareholders to communicate with the Board. Communications should be in writing to Corporate Secretary, Cray Inc., 901 Fifth Avenue, Suite&#160;1000, Seattle, WA 98164, and addressed to the attention of the Board or any of its individual committees or to the Chairman of the Board. Copies of all communications so addressed will be promptly forwarded to the chairman of the committee involved, in the case of communications addressed to the Board as a whole or to individual directors, to the Corporate Governance Committee or, if addressed to the Chairman, to the Chairman of the Board.</font></div><div><a name="s17D6D440ED0750C28794CEAB78AEDFBF"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Director Candidates</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The criteria for Board membership as adopted by the Board include a person&#8217;s integrity, knowledge, judgment, skills, expertise, collegiality, diversity of experience, and other time commitments (including positions on other company boards) in the context of the then-current composition of the Board. The Board has not adopted a specific set of minimum qualifications that are necessary for a nominee to possess. While our Corporate Governance Guidelines do not prescribe diversity standards, as a matter of practice, the Corporate Governance Committee considers diversity in the context of the Board as a whole and considers the personal characteristics (gender, ethnicity, age) and experience (industry, professional, public service) of current and prospective directors to facilitate Board deliberations that reflect a broad range of perspectives. The Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for assessing the appropriate balance of skills brought to the Board by its members and ensuring that an appropriate mix of specialized knowledge (e.g.,&#160;financial, industry, or technology) is represented on the Board. Since 2012, the Corporate Governance Committee has engaged a third-party consulting firm, Heidrick &amp; Struggles, International, Inc., to assist the Corporate Governance Committee in identifying candidates for Board membership.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Once the Corporate Governance Committee has identified a potential director nominee, the Corporate Governance Committee, in consultation with the Chief Executive Officer, evaluates the prospective nominee against the specific criteria that the Board has established and as set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines. If the Corporate Governance Committee determines to proceed with further consideration, then members of the Corporate Governance Committee, the Chief Executive Officer, and other members of the Board, as appropriate, interview the prospective nominee. After completing this evaluation and interview, the Corporate Governance Committee makes a recommendation to the full Board, which makes the final determination whether to appoint the new director.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Corporate Governance Committee will consider candidates for director recommended by shareholders and will evaluate those candidates using the criteria set forth above. Shareholders should accompany their recommendations with a sufficiently detailed description of the candidate&#8217;s background and qualifications to allow the Corporate Governance Committee to evaluate the candidate in light of the criteria described above, a document signed by the candidate indicating his or her willingness to serve if elected, and evidence of the nominating shareholder&#8217;s ownership of our common stock. Such recommendation and documents should be submitted in writing to Corporate Secretary, Cray&#160;Inc., 901 Fifth Avenue, Suite&#160;1000, Seattle, WA 98164, and addressed to the attention of the Corporate Governance Committee.</font></div><div><a name="sDE8C57785A7E57449645DD8DB2BC1466"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Director Nominations by Shareholders</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Bylaws permit shareholders to nominate directors at a shareholders&#8217; meeting. In order to nominate a director at a shareholders&#8217; meeting, a shareholder making a nomination must notify us not fewer than 60 nor more than 90 days in advance of the meeting or, if less than 60 days&#8217; notice or prior public disclosure of the date of the meeting is given or made to the shareholders, by the 10th business day following the first public announcement of the meeting. In addition, the proposal must contain the information required in our Bylaws for director nominations, including:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The nominating shareholder&#8217;s name and address;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A representation that the nominating shareholder is entitled to vote at such meeting;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The number of shares of our common stock that the nominating shareholder owns and when the nominating shareholder acquired such shares;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A representation that the nominating shareholder intends to appear at the meeting, in person or by proxy;</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">14</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The nominee&#8217;s name, age, address, and principal occupation or employment;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">All information concerning the nominee that must be disclosed about nominees in proxy solicitations under the SEC proxy rules; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The nominee&#8217;s executed consent to serve as a director if so elected.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Chairman of the Board, in his discretion, may determine that a proposed nomination was not made in accordance with the required procedures and, if so, disregard the nomination.</font></div><div><a name="s5D2EBEAB27205741B65BE7575F5F814D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Shareholder Proposals</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Annual Meeting</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. For a shareholder proposal to be raised from the floor during the Annual Meeting, written notice of the proposal must be received by us not less than 60 days nor more than 90 days prior to the Annual Meeting or, if less than 60 days&#8217; notice or prior public disclosure of the date of the Annual Meeting is given or made to the shareholders, by the 10th&#160;business day following the first public announcement of the Annual Meeting. The proposal must also contain the information required in our Bylaws for shareholder proposals, including:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A brief description of the business the shareholder wishes to bring before the Annual Meeting, the reasons for conducting such business, and the language of the proposal;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The shareholder&#8217;s name and address;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The number of shares of our common stock that the shareholder owns and when the shareholder acquired them;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A representation that the shareholder is entitled to vote at such meeting;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A representation that the shareholder intends to appear at the Annual Meeting, in person or by proxy; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A brief description of any material interest the shareholder has in the business to be brought before the Annual Meeting.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Chairman of the Board, if the facts so warrant, may determine that any business was not properly brought before the Annual Meeting in accordance with our Bylaws.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Proxy Statement</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. In order for a shareholder proposal to be considered for inclusion in our proxy statement and form of proxy for the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;annual meeting, we must receive the written proposal no later than December&#160;20, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Shareholder proposals also must comply with SEC regulations regarding the inclusion of shareholder proposals in company-sponsored proxy materials.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">If you wish to obtain a free copy of our Articles of Incorporation, Bylaws, or any of our corporate governance documents, please contact Michael C. Piraino, Corporate Secretary, Cray Inc., 901 Fifth Avenue, Suite 1000, Seattle, WA 98164. These documents also are available on our website, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;text-decoration:underline;">www.cray.com</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;under &#8220;Company &#8211; Investors &#8211; Corporate Governance.&#8221;</font></div><div><a name="sF922174F816458EAAE83FD93A0E99E68"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Compensation of Directors</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">In setting director compensation to attract and retain highly qualified individuals to serve on our Board, the Corporate Governance Committee considers the significant amount of time that directors expend in fulfilling their duties, the skill level required of members of the Board, and a general understanding of director compensation at companies of similar size and complexity. Directors who are also our employees receive no additional compensation for their service on the Board. As described more fully below, director compensation is in the form of cash and, to align further the longer-term interests of the individual directors with those of our shareholders, equity, with the grant of a fully vested stock option with a ten-year term upon first joining the Board and annual grants of restricted stock vesting in one year.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Corporate Governance Committee reviews director compensation annually and recommends changes to the Board when appropriate. The Corporate Governance Committee considers the information, analysis, and recommendations provided by our independent compensation consultant, Mercer, including data regarding compensation paid to non-employee directors by companies in our Peer Group (as described in &#8220;Compensation Discussion and Analysis &#8211; Compensation Program Elements and Purposes &#8211; Competitive Market Data&#8221;), as well as publicly available professional compensation surveys, proxy data, and the individual experiences of the Corporate Governance Committee members when it evaluates the appropriate level and form of compensation for non-employee directors.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">15</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sC84E421EDC46504A8F823E94BA7F5CA7"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Cash Compensation</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The following table sets forth the cash compensation policy in </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;for our non-employee directors:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;padding-left:24px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Audit Committee</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">15,000</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td
