style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Compensation Committee</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">$</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">10,000</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:36px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Corporate Governance Committee</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">$</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">5,000</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:36px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Strategic Technology Assessment Committee</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">$</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">5,000</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">(1)</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Based on the recommendations of Mercer and the Corporate Governance Committee, the Board approved an increase to the annual retainer for members of the Compensation Committee from $5,000 to $10,000 effective as of July 1, 2018, so as to remain competitive with Cray&#8217;s Peer Group.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">When the Board creates committees other than the standing committees identified above, the Board determines whether to extend the same committee fee structure to the members of such committees. Members of the Board do not receive any per meeting fees, but we do reimburse all expenses related to participation in meetings of the shareholders, Board, and committees. In addition, we pay for any applicable Washington State and City of Seattle business and occupation taxes and Seattle business license fees incurred by our directors.</font></div><div><a name="sD039E9AE7730536E97C7581A36E6EC59"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Equity Compensation</font></div><div><a name="sAC8E58F00FE959D688293DE7AE3CE1CB"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Stock Options</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Each non-employee director, upon his or her first appointment or election to the Board, is granted a fully vested stock option, with a 10-year term, for 20,000 shares with an exercise price equal to the closing price of our common stock as reported by Nasdaq on the trading date immediately prior to the date of the first appointment or election.</font></div><div><a name="s24970B03BAE2503FADFDACAE142D8385"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Restricted Stock Awards</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Each continuing director first elected or reelected by our shareholders at the annual meeting of our shareholders is granted restricted shares of common stock with such award granted on or immediately following each annual meeting of our shareholders. The number of shares subject to the restricted stock award is determined based on the closing price of our common stock as reported by Nasdaq on the trading day immediately prior to the date of our annual meeting of shareholders. Each continuing director first elected or reelected by our shareholders at the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;annual meeting of our shareholders was granted restricted shares of common stock with a value equal to $110,000 and such awards will vest 100% on the earlier of June 12, </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, or the date that is immediately prior to the date of our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2019</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#160;Annual Meeting. Based on the recommendation of Mercer and the Corporate Governance Committee, the Board approved an increase in the annual stock grant to non-employee directors from $110,000 in value to $140,000 in value so as to remain competitive with Cray&#8217;s Peer Group, effective as of the 2019 Annual Meeting.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The restricted shares vest in full if a non-employee director can no longer serve due to death or Disability (as defined in our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan) or upon a Corporate Transaction (as defined in our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan). The restricted shares are forfeited if, while unvested, a non-employee director resigns or retires from the Board (other than with the express approval of the Corporate Governance Committee) or is asked to leave the Board by the Corporate Governance Committee. Currently, under our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, a non-employee director may receive awards of no more than 150,000 shares per calendar year. If the amendment and restatement of our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan is approved pursuant to Proposal 3, the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan will provide that a non-employee director may receive compensation (including cash and equity awards) representing no more than $500,000 total value in any calendar year; provided that a newly appointed non-employee director may receive compensation (including cash and equity awards) representing no more than $1,000,000 for the calendar year of his or her appointment. See &#8220;Discussion of Proposals Recommended by the Board &#8211; Proposal 3: To Amend and Restate Our 2013 Equity Incentive Plan, as Amended and Restated&#8221; below for additional detail.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">16</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sB76215AFC9B95F97A04161E8B4BB0AC1"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Stock Ownership Guidelines</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Our Board instituted the following stock ownership guidelines for non-employee directors:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Directors are expected to own shares of our common stock, the value of which equals at least $250,000 based on the average closing price per share for our common stock as reported by Nasdaq over the 90&#160;trading days prior to the end of each fiscal year.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Each director has five years following the later of commencement of his or her service on our Board or the adoption or amendment of our stock ownership guidelines to satisfy the minimum share holdings of our stock ownership guidelines.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Directors may sell enough shares to cover the income tax liability when restricted shares vest.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="sB63B410C8D90533CADBC611488627371"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Director Compensation for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2018</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The following table sets forth information regarding compensation earned by our non-employee directors for the year ended </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Mr. Ungaro is not included in this table as he is an employee and he receives no compensation for his service as a director. His compensation as an employee is shown in the &#8220;Summary Compensation Table&#8221; set forth under &#8220;Compensation of the Executive Officers &#8211; Compensation Tables&#8221; below. style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:8.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8.5pt;color:#5e514d;">51</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:8.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Senior Vice President, Research and Development</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Peter J. Ungaro</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">has served our as Chief Executive Officer and as a member of our Board of Directors since August&#160;2005 and as our President since March 2005. From September 2004 until March 2005, Mr. Ungaro served as our Senior Vice President responsible for sales, marketing, and services and from August 2003 until September 2004, he served as our Vice President responsible for sales and marketing. He served as Vice President, Worldwide Deep Computing Sales for IBM Corporation from April 2003 to August 2003 and as Vice President, Worldwide HPC Sales, from February 1999 to April 2003. Mr. Ungaro also held a variety of other sales leadership positions at IBM beginning in 1991. Mr. Ungaro received a B.A. from Washington State University.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Brian C. Henry</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since May 2005. Mr.&#160;Henry is responsible for finance and accounting, manufacturing, and supply chain. Mr. Henry previously served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Onyx Software Corporation, a full suite customer relationship management company, from 2001 to 2005. From 1999 to 2001, he was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Lante Corporation, a public internet consulting company focused on e-markets and collaborative business models. From 1998 to 1999, Mr. Henry was Chief Operating Officer, Information Management Group, of Convergys Corporation, which was spun off from Cincinnati Bell Inc., a diversified service company, where Mr. Henry served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer from 1993 to 1998. From 1983 to 1993, he was with Mentor Graphics Corporation in key financial management roles, serving as Chief Financial Officer from 1986 to 1993. Prior to that, Mr. Henry worked at Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP, an accounting and audit firm, as a Certified Public Accountant. Mr. Henry received a B.S. from Portland State University and an M.B.A. from Harvard University where he was a Baker Scholar.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Charles D. Fairchild</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;has served as our Vice President, Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer since May 2010. Mr. Fairchild previously served as Chief Financial Officer of Radiant Research, Inc., a clinical research and development company, and spent 14 years at Deloitte &amp; Touche LLP. Mr. Fairchild received a B.A. in business administration and an M.B.A. from the University of Washington.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Charles A. Morreale</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;has served as our Senior Vice President, Field Operations since September 2011. Mr.&#160;Morreale is responsible for customer facing organizations around the world including sales and presales, service, benchmarking, and special purpose systems. Prior to such appointment, Mr. Morreale served as our Vice President Custom Engineering responsible for custom engineering. Prior to that, he served as our Vice President responsible for central and field service and benchmarking organizations from April 2005 through January 2009, and, from March 2004 until April&#160;2005, as Director of Worldwide Sales Support. From 2001 to 2004, he was an HPC Sales Executive at IBM and was responsible for worldwide HPC sales activities in the life sciences segment. From 1984 to 2001, he held a variety of positions at Cray Research, Inc. and Silicon Graphics, Inc., starting as a programmer analyst and ending as the Northeast Territory Sales Account Manager. He received a B.S. from The College of New Jersey.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Michael C. Piraino</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">has served as our Senior Vice President Administration, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary since August 2015. Mr. Piraino is responsible for the legal, human resources, information technology, and facilities teams. From September 2011 to August 2015, Mr. Piraino was our Vice President Administration, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary responsible for the legal, human resources, information technology, facilities, and government programs teams. From October 2009 to September 2011, he served as Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary and was responsible for legal and since August 2010, he was responsible for human resources as well. From October 2007 to September 2009, he was an attorney at Fenwick </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">19</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&amp; West LLP (and a predecessor firm), where his practice focused on corporate finance and securities. From October 2006 to June 2007, Mr. Piraino served with the Exbiblio family of technology companies in various positions, including Chief Executive Officer. From May&#160;1999 to October 2006, he was at WatchGuard Technologies, Inc., a provider of network security solutions, in various roles, including Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary. From October 1995 to May 1999, he was an attorney at Perkins Coie LLP, a law firm. Mr. Piraino began his career as a propulsion engineer at The Boeing Company. He received a B.S. in aeronautical and astronautical engineering from Purdue University and a J.D., magna cum laude, from the Seattle University School of Law.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Efstathios &#8220;Stathis&#8221; Papaefstathiou</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;has served as our Senior Vice President of Research and Development since January&#160;2017. Mr. Papaefstathiou is responsible for leading the software and hardware engineering efforts for all of Cray&#8217;s research and development projects. From August 2014 to December 2016, Mr.&#160;Papaefstathiou was Senior Vice President, Engineering for Aerohive Networks, Inc., a computer networking equipment company. From January 2012 through May 2014, he served as the Vice President of Product Development - Cloud Technology with F5&#160;Networks, an application delivery controller company. Previously, Mr.&#160;Papaefstathiou held a number of technical and senior management positions at Microsoft Corporation from August 1999 through December 2011 in the areas of distributed operating systems, data center automation, and robotics, specifically as General Manager from February 2008 through December 2011 and Software Architect from March 2006 through February&#160;2008. Mr.&#160;Papaefstathiou holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Warwick, United Kingdom, and a B.Sc. in Computer Science from North College, Greece.</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">20</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s0A9586F045C552B3A88B78BF279E810D"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:4px;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#26cad3;font-weight:bold;">COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE OFFICERS</font></div><div><a name="s514446B3CB5A52A5BCB913A9A13CED6B"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:12pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Compensation Discussion and Analysis</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Our Compensation Discussion and Analysis (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">CD&amp;A</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) describes the material elements of our compensation for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;for (i)&#160;the individuals who served as our chief executive officer (Mr. Ungaro) and our chief financial officer (Mr.&#160;Henry) during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, and (ii) our three most highly compensated executive officers, other than our chief executive officer and chief financial officer, who served as executive officers as of </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">December&#160;31, 2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;(Messrs.&#160;Morreale and Piraino and Dr.&#160;Papaefstathiou). We refer to these individuals, shown in the table below, as our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Named Executive Officers</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">NEOs</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">. Our CD&amp;A and other sections of this Proxy Statement provide details on the compensation program, including specific policies and plans applicable to our NEOs, and also demonstrates a strong link between pay and performance for our NEOs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="2"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:28%;"></td><td style="width:72%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Name</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Position</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Peter J. Ungaro</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">President&#160;and&#160;Chief&#160;Executive Officer</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Brian C. Henry</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Charles A. Morreale</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Senior Vice President, Field Operations</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Efstathios Papaefstathiou</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Senior Vice President, Research and Development</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Michael C. Piraino</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Senior Vice President Administration, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">This CD&amp;A is structured as follows: </font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">An overview of our compensation program&#8217;s guiding principles, compensation philosophy, and objectives</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A review of the pay elements we consider when structuring executive compensation</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A detailed discussion of our 2018 executive compensation program determinations</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">A summary of our key policies and pay practices used to ensure effective governance and risk mitigation</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s787c71977c9c4e968bde7a30b6d8102f"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Guiding Principles of our Compensation Program</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Compensation Committee believes that executive compensation should be strongly linked to performance and the creation of long-term value for our shareholders. Based on these principles, the Compensation Committee has taken into consideration the unique business aspects of Cray, the perspective of our shareholders, the advice and guidance from our Compensation Committee&#8217;s independent compensation consultant, Mercer, market data and experience relating to the competitive employment environment in which we need to attract and retain talent, and input from our executive management team to develop our compensation program for our executives. The structure of our executive compensation program is intended to enable us to attract, retain, and motivate a talented management team to achieve our business objectives.</font></div><div><a name="sB007DC28217E5D9F8D4D2A835AC9C7AC"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Paying for Performance</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We believe it is critical to our short- and long-term success that our compensation program be closely correlated with performance against our corporate goals, objectives, and results. We experienced a significant industry downturn in the segments of the high-end of the supercomputing market that we target in 2016 and 2017, and while we were not profitable in 2018 we grew our revenue by 16% over the prior year. We strategically invested in R&amp;D to bring our next-generation supercomputing systems code-named &#8220;Shasta&#8221; to market and the importance of those investments is reflected in the selection of a Shasta-related development goal for our annual cash incentive plan. Our compensation philosophy and objectives for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;leveraged three primary pay elements to compensate our NEOs: base salary, short-term cash incentives, and long-term equity incentives. Based on our operational and financial performance, and in light of the analysis from our compensation consultant and other factors described in this Proxy Statement, the Compensation Committee made the following compensation decisions for </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">:</font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">21</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:27%;"></td><td style="width:3%;"></td><td style="width:70%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Pay Element</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">2018 Compensation</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Base Salary</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Maintained base salaries at the same levels as in 2017 for our NEOs.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Annual Cash Incentive Plan</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Target Bonuses</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">: Maintained the target bonus awards as a percentage of base salary at the same levels as 2017 for our NEOs.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Performance Goals and Achievement</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">: For 2018, the annual cash incentive plan for our NEOs was based on two distinct measures: bookings and a subjective Shasta-related product development goal. For the bookings measure, a minimum level of achievement was required to receive any payment for this measure and attainment was based on step-based targets with no interpolation between steps. The Shasta-related product development measure was a binary &#8220;meet or miss&#8221; measure with payout for meeting that measure determined by the level of attainment against the bookings measure (higher attainment against the bookings measure provided for a higher payout percentage for meeting the Shasta-related development measure). As in the past, the Compensation Committee&#8217;s approach has been to set &#8220;stretch&#8221; goals such that attainment at much less than 100% can reflect a significant accomplishment. The level of achievement of our bookings metric and meeting our product development metric resulted in a combined payout percentage of 40%. The Compensation Committee elected to pay a discretionary bonus of approximately 7% of each NEO&#8217;s bonus target to recognize the effective execution and significant progress made on certain critical business goals which established Cray&#8217;s strong competitive position in a slowly recovering market. </font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">See &#8220;2018 Compensation Determinations &#8211; Annual Cash Incentive Compensation Plan&#8221; below.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td rowspan="4" style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Long-Term Equity Awards</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Granted long-term equity awards in the form of:</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Stock options</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">: Generally, with four-year vesting schedules dependent on continued employment and with exercise prices equal to the closing price of our common stock as reported by Nasdaq on the trading date immediately prior to the grant date.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="padding-bottom:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;">Restricted stock units</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">: Generally, with four-year vesting schedules dependent on continued employment.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;background-color:;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">See &#8220;2018 Compensation Determinations &#8211; Long-Term Equity Awards&#8221; below.</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">For fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, approximately 86% of our Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s and 72% of our other NEOs&#8217; total direct compensation consisted of short-term and long-term incentives and was variable and &#8220;at-risk&#8221; which means that this component can vary depending on the performance of the Company and our stock price performance.</font></div><div style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:30px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:30px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:30px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:30px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:30px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">22</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sCDCEED9B10D65C71A04ED50D7D2CB5CF"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Philosophy and Objectives</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We offer technology-differentiated products and services that require a highly educated, specialized, and sought-after workforce and often involve long development cycles. In light of these challenges, our compensation philosophy is to provide and effectively implement a program that is designed to attract, retain, and motivate executives in a competitive employment environment and which is required for us to achieve our strategic and tactical goals and create long-term value for our shareholders. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">To assist in these efforts, our executive compensation program focuses on the following objectives:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Provide effective compensation and benefit programs that are competitive both within our industry and with other relevant organizations with which we compete for executive talent;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Encourage and reward behaviors that ultimately contribute to the achievement of organizational goals that increase long-term shareholder value without encouraging unbalanced short-term focus or inappropriate risk taking, thus fostering an innovative, high-performance culture;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Align the interests of our organization and our executives with the long-term interests of our shareholders;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Provide a retention incentive; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Provide a work environment that promotes integrity, innovation, excellence, teamwork, and respect for the individual.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s33557852FF385B21A53CB10C6143A9AE"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:11pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Compensation Program Elements and Purposes</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We believe our executive compensation program provides the appropriate mix of fixed and variable pay, balancing incentives between short-term operational performance and long-term increases in shareholder value. The executive compensation program encourages the recruitment and retention of executives critical in driving long-term success for the Company in a competitive employment environment. Our executive compensation program reinforces an innovative, high-performance culture while creating alignment with our shareholders by providing equity ownership in Cray. Our NEOs assume greater levels of responsibility for delivering company results than other employees and, therefore, have a more significant portion of their total compensation linked directly to variable pay (pay-at-risk). We revisit our competitive pay mix periodically and in connection with the annual review of our executives&#8217; compensation packages and adjust the mix as needed or appropriate to meet our objectives. We describe below the components of our compensation program and the purpose and key features of the components.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Compensation Committee believes that the overall compensation structure for our NEOs supports our compensation philosophy and objectives and provides, in light of our industry and competitive employment environment, (i)&#160;competitive total target compensation, (ii) sufficient base salaries, (iii) a significant proportion of the total target compensation based on performance and variable or at-risk, and (iv) a meaningful proportion that is equity-based, all to align the NEOs&#8217; interests with those of our shareholders and provide a strong retention and performance incentive.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:13%;"></td><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:3%;"></td><td style="width:50%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Pay Element</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Purpose</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Key Features</font></div></td></tr><tr><td rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Base Salaries</font></div></td><td rowspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">To provide fixed compensation to attract and retain the best executives</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Base pay opportunities for all positions are determined based on: </font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Competitive market data, including global compensation and rewards surveys and other sources, that represent industries and geographies where we compete for talent.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Wingdings;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Internal responsibilities and each executive&#8217;s experience, qualifications, performance, and potential impact within our Company.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Short-Term Incentives</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">To motivate and reward achievement of and significant progress related to critical, tactical, strategic, and financial goals in the short term</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Our NEOs have a portion of targeted total compensation at risk, contingent on company performance during the year measured against corporate objectives.</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">23</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:13%;"></td><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:3%;"></td><td style="width:50%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Pay Element</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Purpose</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#ffffff;">Key Features</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Long-Term Incentives</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">To encourage executives to focus on creating long-term shareholder value and to provide significant retention incentives for highly educated, specialized, and sought-after leaders in the face of companies competing for this talent, particularly those who have significantly greater resources</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Our NEOs have a meaningful portion of their total compensation opportunity linked to our success in or progress toward meeting our long-term objectives and increasing shareholder value. Long-term equity is used for both incentive and retention purposes. The size of each award is based on, among other things, the individual&#8217;s role and contributions. Long-term equity encourages our NEOs to focus on performance and initiatives that should lead to a long-term increase in the market price of our common stock, which benefits our shareholders.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Severance Policy and Change in Control (CIC) Agreements</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">To attract and retain executives and to encourage them to remain focused and engaged during a rumored or actual fundamental corporate change and during any corporate transition</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">We provide certain severance and vesting acceleration benefits to our NEOs if they are terminated without Cause or resign for Good Reason as those terms are defined in the applicable policies, plans, agreements, or equity grants. We also provide vesting acceleration in the event of death, disability, and a limited amount of vesting acceleration in the event of a termination without Cause or retirement in certain circumstances. For change of control related situations, acceleration benefits are subject to a double trigger. See &#8220;Termination of Employment and Change of Control Arrangements&#8221; below for additional detail.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Employee Benefits</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">To meet the health and welfare needs of our employees and their dependents</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div style="text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;color:#5e514d;">Our NEOs participate in the standard benefits programs offered to all employees in the US. We do not provide the NEOs or our other executive officers any deferred compensation or special retirement or pension plans or any benefits or perquisites that are not available to our employees generally.</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Competitive Market Data</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">For its </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;compensation decisions, the Compensation Committee considered the recommendations of its independent compensation consultant, Mercer, to contextualize our overall total compensation approach and general market competitiveness and compared our compensation approach to our peer group companies.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">To assist the Compensation Committee in its deliberations on executive compensation, the Compensation Committee annually reviews and, when necessary, updates our list of peer companies (</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Peer Group</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">) to ensure that the Peer Group companies are appropriate. When considering companies for inclusion in our Peer Group, the Compensation Committee considers companies that are generally:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">In our industry or similar industries such as application software, systems software, communications equipment, electronic components, electronic equipment and instruments, technology hardware, storage, and peripherals;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Similar to us with respect to elements such as operating results, research and development investments and product solutions, size of revenue (currently 0.8x to 2.5x our target revenue for year-end </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">), and market capitalization; and </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9.5pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Those with whom we compete in the recruitment of executive officers.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We increased the revenue measurement point in determining our Peer Group from a range of 0.5x to 2x our target revenue for year-end 2017 to 0.8x to 2.5x our target revenue for year-end 2018 because we are building an executive team capable of supporting an organization with greater revenue than our current levels, which have been impacted by a market downturn, and we often compete for key talent with companies that are much larger than Cray.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">Based on these factors, Mercer&#8217;s evaluation of our independent peer group analysis and its recommendations, as well as executive management&#8217;s input, the Compensation Committee approved the following companies to comprise our Peer Group for 2018: Acacia Communications*, ADTRAN*, Axcelis Technologies*, CalAmp*, Commvault Systems, Comtech Communications*, Electronics For Imaging*, Extreme Networks, F5 Networks, Formfactor*, Harmonic*, Infinera*, Mellanox Technologies, Mercury Systems*, Netgear, Progress Software*, Quantum, and Veeco Instruments*. The Compensation Committee used data from this Peer Group to inform its decisions about each NEO&#8217;s compensation for 2018. However, the Compensation Committee does not benchmark compensation to any particular level or against any specific member of the Peer Group; rather, it used Peer Group </font></div><div><br></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">24</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">information as data points, along with other data points from Aon Hewitt&#8217;s Compensation Governance Pro proxy survey tool, the 2018 Radford Global Technology Survey, and Salary.com&#8217;s International Pay Analysis System, in determining, with the assistance of Mercer, the appropriate overall total compensation. Companies noted with asterisks above were added to our Peer Group for 2018 based on an evaluation of industry, revenue size, business description, R&amp;D investment, and other metrics that provide for a meaningful peer comparison. ANSYS, Avid Technology, Barracuda Networks, Cavium, Fortinet, and Super Micro Computer were removed because they are no longer considered appropriate comparisons to Cray. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Determining Named Executive Officer Pay</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">As in previous years and in addition to the market data described above, in making specific decisions regarding each NEO&#8217;s (other than Mr. Ungaro&#8217;s) compensation, the Compensation Committee considered Mr. Ungaro&#8217;s recommendations. The committee also considered factors such as the internal and external relative parity among senior management, the experience and performance of individual officers, their current compensation levels, their potential impact within Cray, and the reasonableness of the officer&#8217;s compensation in light of our compensation objectives and our operational and financial performance. We have a relatively flat salary structure for our executive officers with the significant differences in total compensation among the executive officers reflected in short-term cash and long-term equity incentive awards. This approach helps us provide a market competitive base salary and provides the potential for higher compensation levels based on performance-dependent, short- and long-term incentives.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">The Compensation Committee recognizes that we compete for our NEOs, including Mr.&#160;Ungaro, with a variety of organizations in the high-performance computing industry and other high-tech sectors, including much larger companies. The Compensation Committee factors in each NEO&#8217;s impact and delivery of results for the organization, their unique industry expertise, experiences, skills, role, competitive data, and market conditions. The Compensation Committee also supplemented specific compensation information with its collective experience, judgment, and observations of trends to establish the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;compensation for our NEOs and other executive officers.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Results of the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Say-on-Pay Vote</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We value the input of our shareholders on our compensation program. We hold an advisory vote on executive compensation on an annual basis. When designing our </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;executive compensation program for our NEOs, the Compensation Committee carefully considered, among other things, the vote results from our prior annual meeting, including the results of our say-on-pay vote, with over 96% of votes cast in favor of our executive pay program. We also engage in conversations with our large, active shareholders on an ongoing basis, which provides them with an opportunity to raise any concerns or questions relating to our executive compensation program. Given that the </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">&#32;say-on-pay vote reflected strong support for our compensation practices, and that we did not receive any significant shareholder feedback requiring compensation changes during </font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">2018</font><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">, we have maintained our existing compensation policies and practices. The Compensation Committee will continue to consider the results of our say-on-pay votes and shareholder feedback when making future compensation decisions for our NEOs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;font-weight:bold;">Pay and Governance Policies and Practices</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:4px;text-align:justify;padding-left:0px;text-indent:24px;font-size:9.5pt;"><font style="font-family:Arial;font-size:9.5pt;color:#5e514d;">We have adopted the following pay and governance policies and practices to ensure that our pay program supports our compensation philosophy and mitigates compensation risk:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="2"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:4%;"></td><td style="width:96%;"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:1px solid #5e514d;background-color:#26cad3;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-left:1px solid #5e514d;border-right:1px solid #5e514d;border-top:1px solid #5e514d;"><div
